Authors: Bonacim, CAG; Nardi, PCC; da Silva, RLM; Cruz, R; Bonizio, RC
Author Full Names: Grespan Bonacim, Carlos Alberto; Ciampaglia Nardi, Paula Carolina; Menezes da Silva, Ricardo Luiz; Cruz Junior, Roberto; Bonizio, Roni Cleber
Article Title: Investment projects in agribusiness: cost-volume-profit analysis considering uncertainty and risk
Author Keywords: Cost-volume-profit; Risk; Uncertainty
Abstract: Evaluations of projects in the agribusiness sector make use of discounted cash flows may consider the risk discount rate for cash flows. However, these studies assume simplifying assumptions in relations Cost-Volume-Profit (CVP). Thus, this research aims to advance the treatment stochastic, as it believes that analysis of the CVP in its traditional model, represents a decision tool, consecrated, but the usefulness of this tool is limited by the deterministic nature that the relationship takes, proposing further research on the effects of the merger scenarios or probability distributions in the analyzes CVP aimed at agribusiness project evaluations under conditions of uncertainty and risk. To achieve this goal we conducted a simulation from real data, allowing a reflection on the limitations of traditional CVP analysis, supported by a number of simplifying assumptions, in particular: assumptions of linearity and low applicability in conditions of risk and uncertainty. The results showed that the analysis can be extended CVP and adapted to the reality experienced by managers, considering the existence of multi-product and the presence of uncertainty, or generation of random numbers by simulation frequencies and to infer probabilities.

Authors: Nogueira, LRT; Nuintin, AA; Reis, RP; Portugal, ND; Curi, MA
Author Full Names: Teixeira Nogueira, Leandro Rivelli; Nuintin, Adriano Antonio; Reis, Ricardo Pereira; Portugal, Nilton dos Santos; Curi, Maria Aparecida
Article Title: Performance and economic results by field activity in coffee
Author Keywords: Economic Performance; Theory of costs; Activity coffee
Keywords Plus: PRODUCTION COSTS; OPPORTUNITY COST; MATO-GROSSO; VIABILITY; SYSTEM; MILK
Abstract: The study aims to identify, using the technique of discriminant analysis, the variables that affect the economic outcome of plots in coffee industry. The study is characterized as explanatory research approach with quantitative data. The collected data is related to the activity plots of coffee 2010-2011 harvest, worked in a rural organization. For data analysis, was used as the statistical analysis discriminant. We first calculated the economic result of the stands, and then classified into two groups: Group 1 - positive economic result and Group 2 - negative economic result. To analyze the results were defined nine variables. According to the result of the discriminant function, only the variable productivity of the stands was selected as the largest contributor to estimate the economic result of positive or negative fields. Calculated the centroids of Groups 1 and 2, drew up a classification of results depending on the expected amount of bags produced per block. Thus, the function resulting from the discriminant analysis can contribute to the organization's rural manager make decisions based on the outcome anticipated projected economic, considering the characteristics of the plots of coffee activity.

Authors: Ruberto, IV; Mareth, T; Paim, ESE; Pieniz, LP
Author Full Names: Ruberto, Isabel Von Grafen; Mareth, Taciana; Everlin Paim, Eliane Suely; Pieniz, Luciana Paim
Article Title: Contribution of linear programming in cost management and productivity in a rural property
Author Keywords: Linear Programming; Costs; Rural property
Abstract: This study aims to assist the process of managing the rural properties, from the use of cost management and the mathematical tool of linear programming. To achieve this goal, the study was organized in two phases, with the first aim was to organize data and production costs of a period of twelve months at a farm producing grain to verify the contribution margin and profit achieved. The second step, in turn, was to develop mathematical models that optimize production and consequently maximize the contribution margin and profit using the available resources on the property. This research is classified as documentary, quantitative and case study. After the study we found that the linear programming tool can contribute efficiently in managing the property costs, and can increase their profitability by approximately 5.83%.

Authors: de Souza, FJV; Barros, CD; Araújo, AO; da Silva, MC
Author Full Names: Viana de Souza, Fabia Jaiany; Barros, Celio da Costa; Araujo, Aneide Oliveira; da Silva, Mauricio Correa
Article Title: Scientific Production of biological assets and agricultural products: a study between 2006 and 2011
Author Keywords: Biological Activity; Agricultural Produce; CPC 29; IAS 41
Abstract: This research aims at analyzing the scientific literature on biological assets and agricultural products in articles, dissertations and theses national and international articles between 2006 and 2011. We used descriptive research, literature and qualitative. The results revealed that 11 articles on biological asset and agricultural produce have been presented in national conferences analyzed, three articles were published in national journals surveyed, were found two national papers on this subject and no thesis. It was further observed that 6 international articles on this topic were published in the period and that among the international productions on this subject, there were a dissertation and a thesis. It is concluded that 24 studies on biological assets and agricultural products were found in the period 2006 to 2011, Congress USP Controller and Accounting was one that had the largest number of articles related to this issue, the magazine RePEc, Accounting and Thinking Universe published book, each one, an article on the subject, the authors had only one published paper and the themes of the research was the application of IAS 41 and accounting treatment for biological assets, the national papers were found from the graduate programs in Sciences statements.

Authors: de Carvalho, FS; Paulo, E; Sales, ICH; Ikuno, LM
Author Full Names: de Carvalho, Flavia Siqueira; Paulo, Edilson; Henriques Sales, Isabel Cristina; Ikuno, Luciana Miyuki
Article Title: Biological assets: disclosure of public firms listed in the Ibovespa
Author Keywords: Biological Assets; Agricultural Produce; CPC 29
Abstract: This paper aims to examine the adoption of CPC 29 - biological assets - among companies listed at Ibovespa. It was established by the Brazilian Securities and Exchange Commission that as off 2012 enterprises would have to register its biological assets by fair value (biological assets were previously recorded by formation cost method), recognizing the impacts of the biological assets at the financial statements. To achieve the established purpose of the paper, it was performed a content analysis of the entities subjected to CPC 29 listed at Ibovespa. For that, we collected the 2010 quarterly and annual reports. As so, it was noticed that the main supersector, with 100% of the enterprises with biological assets is Cellulose & Paper. 1/3 of the companies from Basic Resources supersector (Oil & Gas sector) recognize biological assets, while in the supersector of Food & Beverage 3/5 of the entities disclosure biological assets. More else, five companies early adopted the rules at the quarterly financial reports and annual reports, but one didn't disclosure biological assets at the annual financial report.

Authors: Semerci, A; Parlakay, O; Çelik, AD
Author Full Names: Semerci, Arif; Parlakay, Oguz; Celik, Ahmet Duran
Article Title: Gross margin analysis in dairy cattle: a case study of Hatay Province, Turkey
Author Keywords: Dairy; Variable cost; Gross margin; Turkey
Abstract: Main objective of this study is to calculate the gross margin for the dairy cattle enterprises in the Hatay Province in the Mediterranean Region of Turkey. Main material of the study consists of the primary data compiled by the surveys from 141 dairy cattle breeder enterprises which are determined by layered random sampling method. Data obtained from the research area in 2013 is reviewed according to the enterprises' size groups and enterprises' fair average on the basis of the number of suckling cow. According to the results of the study, in the enterprises reviewed, there is an average of 4.87 heads suckling cow and 7.85 Large Animal Unit (LAU) per enterprise. In the enterprises it is determined that an average of 27 tons of milk is produced in one lactation period. Milk yield per suckling cow is 5.6 ton/lactation. Among the enterprises surveyed, 59% of them had 1-4 head, 33% had 5-9 head and 8% had 10 head and above suckling cows. It has been also determined that the feed cost was the highest as 81.6% in the variable costs in the dairy cattle breeder enterprises according to the enterprise mean values. Following this, there were the veterinary-medicine costs (8.2%), electricity costs (2.4%), variable labour costs (1.8%), water and cleaning supplies (1.8%), artificial insemination costs (1.6%) and other costs (2.6 %). When the dairy cattle breeder enterprises are examined according to their size groups, it is seen that large enterprises (10 head and above) have produced more milk per suckling cow and gained higher milk yield and more gross margin compared to the small (1-4 head) and middle (5-9 head) enterprises.

Article Title: Structure and factor intensity feature of agricultural trade in China
Author Keywords: Agricultural trade; Trade structure; Factor intensity
Abstract: Structural optimization of agricultural trade is an important path for China's achieving economic transformation and upgrading, so it is necessary to discuss factor intensity during structural adjustment. Structure based on status quo of agricultural trade was analyzed and the feature of factor intensity was detected. Some conclusions were achieved as follow: the degree of product concentration of import was comparatively high and that of export was comparatively low; the processing degree of agricultural import was generally higher than that of agricultural export, no type of China's agricultural product for exporting obviously owned higher proportion than that of the relevant other; proportion of the land-intensive import, proportion of the labor-intensive export and proportion of the resource-intensive import and export would increase, while proportions of the labor-intensive import and the land-intensive export would appear decreasing trend.

Authors: Rodrigues, NA; dos Reis, EA; Tavares, M
Author Full Names: Rodrigues, Nubia Aparecida; dos Reis, Ernando Antonio; Tavares, Marcelo
Article Title: Influence of climatic factors on the cost of production of Arabica Coffee
Author Keywords: Arabica coffee; Production costs; Precipitation; Temperature; Phenological phases
Abstract: Arabica coffee production cost management faces challenges due to the diversity of factors that affect its formation within farms. Among the various factors that interfere in arabica coffee production costs formation, climatic factors stand out, especially temperature and precipitation conditions. Climatic condition behavior patterns during each of these phases interfere directly in the productive performance of the plant. Theoretical review points out that the productivity of the crop affects the formation of the production costs of the crop. Thus, the aim was to investigate arabica coffee production cost behavior in relation to the climatic factors during the phenological phases of the coffee plant. For this investigation we used descriptive analysis and multiple linear regression (R-2). In the first stage it was observed that the cities with adverse climatic conditions showed the highest total production cost and lower productivity levels. The results of the multiple linear regressions (R-2) presented waste autocorrelation problems and multicollinearity, and therefore need further investigation. The relevance of this study is mainly associated to the theoretical contribution of the behavior of arabica coffee production costs in relation to climatic factors, due to the scarcity of studies of such nature.

Article Title: Evaluation of technical and economic performance: a comparative study between hybrid corn and Bt corn
Author Keywords: Maize; Cost of Production; Profitability; Innovation
Abstract: The present article approaches an analysis of the yield between the hybrid maize and the Bt maize in the city of Faxinal of the Guedes-SC, during the harvest of 2010/2011. In this study of case, the results had demonstrated the total cost of production for the hybrid maize in the value of R$ 2,565, 04/ha and 3.49% superior for the Bt maize with R$ 2,666, 12/ha. The gotten profitability was of R$ 1,309, 96/ha for hybrid maize and again 12.66% superior for the maize Bt de R$ 1,475, 88/ha. A productivity of 155 was gotten sacas/ha, for the hybrid maize against 165,68 sc/ha for the Bt maize, about 10,68 bags more for hectare or 6.89% of the production. The break-even point for the hybrid maize was reached with a productivity of 102,60 sc/ha or 51.07% of the production, in against departure the Bt maize needed bigger production to reach the break-even point, with 106,64 sc/ha or 55.36% of the production. Finally, one evidenced that superiority economic technique and of the Bt maize.

Authors: Battistussi, F; Antonelli, RA; Bortoluzzi, SC
Author Full Names: Battistussi, Fernando; Antonelli, Ricardo Adriano; Bortoluzzi, Sandro Cesar
Article Title: Verification and analysis in soybean production for small rural producers
Author Keywords: Income verification; Small rural properties; Cost management; soybean
Abstract: Literature indicates the difficulty of small rural producer perform the management of his/her property, mainly, in relation to the management of cost and incomes. Thereby, this work intends to achieve the follow aim: to verify and to analyze financial incomes of soybean production during harvests of 2010/2011 year and 2011/2012 year in a property of Itapejara D'Oeste, Parana state. The methodology used for the investigations of yield cost was one suggested by the Companhia Nacional de Abastecimento (CONAB). This methodology enables to calculate through processing of collected data in Excel's spreadsheets - the cost per acre of production, determination of revenue, contribution margin, breakeven point and statement of income. The found results demonstrate that the studied rural property had income in both periods; however, there was a large yield reduction in the second year due to drought. It is possible to conclude that the present research contributes to management of cost and incomes in small rural properties and that the methodology presented by CONAB can contribute to the managerial development in these properties.

Authors: Ignjatijevic, S; Matijasevic, J; Milojevic, I
Author Full Names: Ignjatijevic, Svetlana; Matijasevic, Jelena; Milojevic, Ivan
Article Title: Revealed comparative advantages and competitiveness of the processed food sector for the Danube countries
Author Keywords: Processed food sector; Danube region countries; Competitiveness and comparative advantage
Abstract: In this paper, we analyzed the level of competitiveness and comparative advantages of processed food products of the Danube region countries. The level of competitive advantage, we measured using five indices: RXA, RTA, ln RXA, RC and RCA. For each Danube region country, we investigate the existence of correlation between these indices and found which processed food products stand out with a positive competitive advantage. The research established the existence of promoting international trade with products of the food industry. We also found that in the Czech Republic, Hungary, Germany, Serbia and Ukraine recorded an increase in competitiveness.

Authors: do Amaral, AO; Guth, SC; da Motta, MEV; Camargo, ME; Menegotto, MLA; Pacheco, MTM
Author Full Names: do Amaral, Adans Oliveira; Guth, Sergio Cavagnoli; Ventura da Motta, Marta Elisete; Camargo, Maria Emilia; Arbugeri Menegotto, Margarete Luisa; Martiningui Pacheco, Maria Teresa
Article Title: Economic viability of the culture of potato
Author Keywords: Potato Culture; Analysis; Economic Viability
Abstract: The wealth generated by farming in Brazil has contributed to the development of some regions. The culture of potato, inserted into the agricultural landscape, though still little explored in the country. Potato production in Sao Jose dos Missing has achieved prominence in acreage and productivity. The city, today, ranks second in the ranking of the largest producers of potatoes in the state of Rio Grande do Sul, and the potato crop is the main economic activity conducted in the city. Thus, this study developed in the form of empirical research and literature, aimed at investigating the economic viability of potato through analysis of managerial accounting, with the application of accounting and management tools, culminating with the case study. At the end it was possible to measure the return and the value added generated by the activity, as well as the social impact and economic viability, benefit to the farmers and all entities involved in the production process.

Authors: de Lima, JD; Scheitt, LC; Boschi, TD; da Silva, NJ; de Meira, AA; Dias, GH
Author Full Names: de Lima, Jose Donizetti; Scheitt, Luiz Carlos; Boschi, Taciane de Fatima; da Silva, Nezio Jose; de Meira, Ademar Alves; Dias, Gabriel Hiss
Article Title: Proposals of adjustment for the payback calculation of funded investment projects
Author Keywords: Economic and Financial Viability; Discounted Payback; Agribusiness
Abstract: The objective of this paper is to propose alternative ways to calculate the Payback of investment projects funded with debt capital, contemplating whether or not a grace period. In this sense, two new ways of calculating the Payback are proposed. To illustrate the proposed methods, we used a case study of the implementation of an agroindustrial complex contemplating a processing unit and an industrial seed treatment in an agricultural cooperative with operations in the Southwest of Parana and West of Santa Catarina. This research is classified as documentary, quantitative and case study. The results showed the importance of using the several Payback calculations proposed here. The project under study proved feasible under an economic perspective within an analysis horizon of 144 months. However, while for the return of the invested capital a period of 36 months was initially found, for the full amortization of the funding a period of 120 months was required, which is the recommended Payback.

Authors: Fehr, LCFD; Duarte, SL; Tavares, M; dos Reis, EA
Author Full Names: Francisco de Almeida Fehr, Lara Cristina; Duarte, Sergio Lemos; Tavares, Marcelo; dos Reis, Ernando Antonio
Article Title: Temporal analysis of variable costs of arabic culture coffee in the main producing regions of Brazil
Author Keywords: Agribusiness; Arabica Coffee; Costs
Abstract: The production costs of the coffee plantation needs to be well manage to get a better profitability. Physiological and environmental aspects, the cultivation and the market are some non controllable factors that influence this culture. But there are others that can be controlled by the enterprising. In this way as well as the production resources are used to boost the productivity, better results can be obtain. In this sense, this study aimed to identify the variables of Arabica coffee costs that showed significant differences in the period from 2003 to 2009, in the main producing regions of the country. The methodology used was the quantitative approach, consisting in a descriptive research, and the data collection procedure employed was the documentary research. Using the analysis of variance and the Scott-Knott test (1974) it was observed no fluctuation in costs between the years analyzed. The items that most influenced the total costs were the temporary and fixed labor (32%) as well as fertilizers and pesticides (30%).

Authors: Gül, M; Akpinar, G; Demircan, V; Yilmaz, H; Bal, T; Arici, SE; Polat, M; San, B; Eraslan, F; Kart, CÖ; Özdamar, D; Yilmaz, SG
Author Full Names: Gul, Mevlut; Akpinar, Goksel; Demircan, Vecdi; Yilmaz, Hasan; Bal, Tufan; Arici, S. Evrim; Polat, Mehmet; San, Bekir; Eraslan, Figen; Kart, Cagla Ormeci; Ozdamar, Damla; Yilmaz, Serife Gulden
Article Title: Economic analysis of early-warning system in apple cultivation: a turkish case study
Author Keywords: Profit margin; Net profit; Adoption level
Abstract: In this study Antalya, Denizli, Isparta, Karaman, Konya and Nigde province' farms which are dominant in apple cultivation has been compared in terms of early warning adoption level and some social economic indicators. With this scope in the study region stratified sampling method had been used and sampling size has been determined 267 farms. In these regions early warning system has been used since the late 80's for black spot and codling moth. Especially after 2000's successful results of the system provide that a positive effect of the farmers' adoption level. According to the study results there is a high adoption level of farmers on apple cultivation from early warning system thus 41.6% of the farmers exactly adapt the pesticide application time from early warning system but farmers have lack of information about the system. There is a positive relation between adoption and education level, both levels increase at the same time. Early warning adoption levels also decrease unit production cost of apple. Relative profit has a statistically meaningful relation between early warning adoption level (p<0.05). Total pesticide cost increased 10.92% due to unnecessary usage. Many small farms in these regions can increase their income and provide market advantages with some amelioration in the early warning system, enlargement of practise areas.

Article Title: Implementation of ISO 22000 in a storage unit of a grain cooperative from the midwest region of Parana
Author Keywords: Management; Control; Quality; Cooperative; ISO 22.000
Abstract: The current global economy and increasing demands from the customers take more and more companies to seek a new methodology in their production systems or service delivery. Cooperatives because they fit within the food production chain have to resort to an improvement in their processes of Reception, Processing, Storage and Shipment of Grain deployment and certification following the procedures of ISO 22000, which deals with food safety and aims continuous improvement. The methodology was based on literature review, followed by a case study on the implementation of ISO 22000 in a grain storage unit of one of the largest cooperatives in the Midwest region of Parana State. The aim of this article was to demonstrate the difficulties and expected improvements during the Implementation of ISO 22000 in a Storage Unit Grains Cooperative located in a state of Parana.

Authors: do Nascimento, JCHB; Bernardes, JR; de Sousa, WD; Lancini, SP
Author Full Names: Hipolito Bernardes do Nascimento, Joao Carlos; Bernardes, Juliana Reis; de Sousa, Wellington Dantas; Lancini, Simone Piton
Article Title: Target costing, strategic tool of support in decision of production? A multi case study in Sao Francisco Valley
Author Keywords: Target Costing; Strategic Management; Strategic Cost Management
Abstract: Given the current scenario of increased competition, the accounting information becomes an essential element to achieving business success, namely the maximization of firm value. In this respect, strategic cost management assumes role of much importance for of business success, being the Target Costing one of its most relevant topics. Based on the American concept of Value Engineering, the Target Costing emerged as a dynamic system subtracting costs and, above all, profit planning. Based on the insights from research Kee and Matherly (2006), Kee (2010) and Nascimento et al. (2013), the present study proposed to investigate, through a multi case study with seven product and six wineries located in the Valley of the Sao Francisco, if the decisions taken based on Target Costing, in fact, always add economic value to firms. The results show to be relevant at the moment that, through empirical evidence, were confirmed the findings of previous studies, reinforcing the need to adjust the traditional methodology of Target Costing.

Authors: Ribeiro, RRM; Gayego, F; Mattiello, K; de Oliveira, NC
Author Full Names: Martins Ribeiro, Roberto Rivelino; Gayego, Fernanda; Mattiello, Kerla; de Oliveira, Neuza Corte
Article Title: Application of contribution margin as a decision making tool in a broiler farm with and without agribusiness integration
Author Keywords: Poultry; Variable Costing; Contribution Margin
Abstract: Faced with growing the Brazilian poultry industry has shown, especially in the northwest of Parana, has been common for most small farms have a chicken shed, because, due to the dynamism of activity, this helps to boost the family income and production in Brazil, which currently occupies first place in export of chicken meat. Increases in technology associated with the strategic planning of agribusinesses contributed to this position. Given the importance of granjeira activity in the region, the survey aimed to apply the contribution margin as a tool for decision on the management of a farm of broilers with and without integration to agribusiness. Rationale for this study was conducted a review of premises costs, focusing on management and decision tools from variable costing. The methodology used was the descriptive and exploratory, considering the applied nature of the study, which linked the qualitative and quantitative methods for the processing of data, means that the environment also refers to a field survey conducted in the form of a case study. Data collection took place through property visits, interviews, document analysis and reporting activity. The survey results showed that working in system integration, the activity produces a positive contribution margin, whereas if you choose not to work in the integrated model, the contribution margin becomes negative.

Authors: Copetti, LS; Coronel, DA; Vieira, KM
Author Full Names: Copetti, Leonardo Sangoi; Coronel, Daniel Arruda; Vieira, Kelmara Mendes
Article Title: Transmission of exchange rate changes for export prices of soybeans in Brazil and Argentina
Author Keywords: Exchange; Export; Pass-through
Abstract: Brazil and Argentina are the second and third largest exporters of grain soybean respectively. To increase competitiveness in agribusiness, sometimes government shave adopted policies of currency devaluation. This paper aimed to verify whether these policies adopted by governments are effective on the export price of soybeans, that is, if the exchange rate changes are passed on to the export price. To this end, we adopted the following research problem: there is a difference between the degree of pass-through to export prices of the grain markets of soybeans in Brazil and Argentina in the period 03/1999 to 02/2011? In addition, as a method, we used time-series econometrics to estimate the proposed model. The results revealed a coefficient of incomplete price transmission into Brazil, indicating that the price transmission takes place only partially. As for Argentina the coefficient was zero, indicating absence of price transmission.

Authors: Lillo, F; Acuña, E; Vásquez, F; Mena, P; Rodríguez, R
Author Full Names: Lillo, Francisco; Acuna, Eduardo; Vasquez, Felipe; Mena, Pablo; Rodriguez, Rolando
Article Title: Willingness to pay of smallholders for soil restoration: results of a contingent valuation survey
Author Keywords: Soil erosion; Logit model; Contingent valuation
Keywords Plus: SOCIOECONOMIC DETERMINANTS; WELFARE EVALUATIONS; MARKET GOODS; SRI-LANKA; CONSERVATION; FARMERS; PREFERENCES; DECISION; ETHIOPIA
Abstract: This work presents the willingness to pay of smallholders of the rainfed from Central Chile by means of implementing restoration projects of soils degraded by erosion, covering an area that extends from Libertador Bernardo O'Higgins Region to Biobio Region. In order to determine the extent of welfare in smallholders by means of the application of soil restoration projects, the Contingent Valuation Method was used. This model assumes the linear functional form of an indirect function of usefulness and a logical distribution for the method of stated preferences in the format of a simple dichotomous model. The determinant variables of the willingness to pay that were significant were evaluated. These variables were the condition of the owner and the perception of low performance derived from the erosion condition of the land, unlike variables such as yields, expenses or costs which can be due to the perception as such in the economy of the smallholder who lives off the land. As welfare measurement the trimmed means was measured, resulting in 7.17 US$ ha(-1) and adding -to the total surface of the inland rainfed- of 2,463,761 US$ per month.

Author Full Names: dos Santos Lima, Daniel Ferreira; Miranda, Gilberto Jose
Article Title: Economic and financial viability analysis of the use of biogas to produce electricity
Author Keywords: Biodigester; Swine production; Economic viability
Abstract: Pig farmers are nowadays facing the issue of what should be done with wastes from raising pigs, due to this waste being considered potential pollutants to the environment. One of the possible disposal alternatives is the use of biodigesters, which are considered a good treatment and disposal of the waste, being able to generate benefits that aggregate value to the business. The present study aimed to analyze the economic and financial viability of the use of digester gas to produce electricity, taking into account the expenses demanded for the installation and maintenance of the equipment. A case study was conducted on a property near the city of Uberlandia, Minas Gerais. As a result of the study, the conclusion is that the investment is viable from an economic perspective, for it showed a positive Net Present Value (NPV), representing gains to the property, the owner and the environment, which may extend to the community in general, due to the reduction and compensation of gases that contribute to the greenhouse effect on the plane.

Authors: Belli, AP; Andruchechen, JR; Richartz, F; Borgert, A
Author Full Names: Belli, Ana Paula; Andruchechen, Jean Roberto; Richartz, Fernando; Borgert, Altair
Article Title: Structuring of a hybrid costing system in a service provider company to forest harvesting
Author Keywords: Forest Harvesting; ABC; UEP
Abstract: The objective of this article is to structure a hybrid cost system using the ABC and UEP's methods to meet the needs a providing services company of forest harvesting that doesn't have a system of costs control. This study is an action-search with an objective descriptive-exploratory, that the collect of informations involve the observation of operations, interviews, documental search in operations reports and bibliography is founded in books and articles related with the topic. With the results it can be observe the applicability join of the ABC and of the UEP as framework, reaching to the value of cost of base activity R$278.824,31, with the semestral capacity of production in 1,00 UEP. Later, reach to the total cost of the R$2.077.347,74 at the process of Thinning and R$1.164.684,33 at the Clear Cutting on the second semester of 2011. The highlight is by the application of the statistic technical of Person's linear correlation in definition of cost drivers of activities. This way, observe how it is used the resources by providing services and how much the effort each one of the activities demands. The model can be used in subsequent period, as long as that updates the values of UEP.

Authors: Baptista, AE; Silva, WAC; Araújo, EAT
Author Full Names: Baptista, Antonio Eustaquio; Castro Silva, Wendel Alex; Tavares Araujo, Elisson Alberto
Article Title: Internal control system in milk enterprises of the region of the Alto Paranaiba/MG
Author Keywords: Milk Industry; Control System; System of Internal Control
Abstract: We verify whether the use of system of internal controls milk enterprises of Alto Paranaiba/MG is consistent with the Coso model (1992), in the perception of their managers. For their achievement, and research of a descriptive nature, was based on a study in 9 (18 percent) of the 51 milk industry in the region, with the questionnaires and verification of control categories most frequently in these companies. We found there was evidence of the implementation of the Model through a number of categorical variables identified in these milk industry. However, these companies still need more attention to controls over the breach of internal rules, which can interfere with the implementation of their strategies. Although the appropriate management and documentation of transactions, there is a lack of formal and standardized procedures that can reduce the quality of the final product, causing rework and/or unnecessary spending. And the lack of knowledge of employees about the plans and controls environments, and little attention to the quality of information to be used in decision making, can negatively influence them, demanding to formalize procedures. The recognition of the importance by managers in the management of milk industries, the factors studied, can contribute to the development that business.

Authors: de Oliveira, CA; Almeida, JCD; de Souza, MAF; Macedo, MAD
Author Full Names: de Oliveira, Carlos Augusto; de Carvalho Almeida, Joao Carlos; Ferreira de Souza, Marco Antonio; da Silva Macedo, Marcelo Alvaro
Article Title: Production cost on beef cattle in the dynamic cost vision: the case of Fazenda Arural
Author Keywords: dLivestock management; Livestock Profitability; Rural administration
Abstract: The production costs management of any product should be designed to ensure that all items that comprise it are contemplated. Sometimes it can be observed that over-order items can lead to financial spreadsheet to produce biased budget results that create myopia in relation to the actual product cost. In this context, the aim of this paper is to present a proposal to measure beef cattle production cost that have simple input of information and allows that results be released monthly, what facilitate the monitoring and management activity. The proposed model has earned the designation of dynamic cost for presenting monthly results independents of the calendar year. The model was tested during twenty six months on the farm for fattening cattle, which allowed the evaluation of month activity profitability for the last 12 months, as well as the monthly cost of arroba produced on Arural farm. In the updated values for July 2010, using IGPM, the activity showed a cost of R$ 45.46 per arroba and 27.3% of profitability on financial investments made during the last 12 months of analysis.

Authors: Voss, BD; Pfitscher, ED; Vicente, EFR; Ferreira, LF
Author Full Names: Voss, Barbara de Lima; Pfitscher, Elisete Dahmer; Rodrigues Vicente, Ernesto Fernando; Ferreira, Luiz Felipe
Article Title: Disclosure of environmental impacts within the agribusiness chain: a study on transport of solid waste in a city in Santa Catarina
Author Keywords: Disclosure of environmental impacts; Solid waste; Gases expelled in urban transport
Abstract: Mrs. Brundtland enunciated in 1987 on sustainable development that thought this article aims at identifying as evidenced the environmental impact of gases emitted during the transport of solid waste in a company from Santa Catarina (Brazil) in 2009. The methodological procedures illustrated by the design of research. The research is exploratory and descriptive, case study, documental, qualitative. The study is longitudinal, the focus of research is the environmental disclosure. The findings show that the lack of environmental disclosure in financial statements including the notes or sustainability reports, however there is environmental information of the gases emitted during the transport of solid waste, such as 54,341 ton NOx, 13,997 ton CO, 7831 ton NMVOC, 6,998 ton SO2 and 3447 ton CO2. The results indicate the existence of environmental liabilities, among them the gases emitted during transport and also identify them as such liabilities can be disclosed in the notes because they are non-monetary values.

Article Title: An empirical analysis of the influence of information service input on the logistics efficiency of farm produce in China based on the panel data from 2000 to 2011
Author Keywords: SFA method; Agro-product logistics; Technical efficiency; Information service investment; Influence
Abstract: This paper uses stochastic frontier production function to measure the logistics efficiency of agricultural products and then analyze the factors that affect the efficiency based on panel data of 30 provinces, cities, and areas from 2000 similar to 2011 in China. The results show that the China's logistics efficiency of agricultural products is not high and varies from region to region. Information service investment is found to have an active influence on the logistics efficiency and the regional difference in logistics efficiency is derived from the difference in the marginal return rates caused by the uneven development in these regions.

Authors: Zekic, V; Puvaca, N; Milic, D; Beukovic, M; Glamocic, D; Vukelic, N; Lukac, D
Author Full Names: Zekic, Vladislav; Puvaca, Nikola; Milic, Dragan; Beukovic, Milos; Glamocic, Dragan; Vukelic, Natasa; Lukac, Dragomir
Article Title: Effect of garlic powder in broiler chicken nutrition: emphasis on production economic efficiency costs and chicken meat quality
Author Keywords: Economic aspects; Costs; Chickens
Abstract: Aim of this study was to examine the effect of 2% of garlic powder addition in the broiler chicken diet on productive performance, breast meat quality and economic efficiency costs of this kind of broilers chicken production. For the experiment total of 600, one day-old chicken of hybrid line Hubbard was divided in two groups of 75 chickens in four repetitions. Chicken were fed with three diet mixtures. Experiment lasted 42 days. Chicken with addition of garlic had recorded significant higher (p < 0.05) body weight of 2019.0g, compared the chicken in control treatment which have achieved final body weight of 1949.5g. The calculation of the total cost includes the cost of materials or supplies, the cost of energy, the cost of wages and depreciation. Results of the economic efficiency analyses found that the cost of broiler chickens per group is growing, in the control group 2.02 $/kg, while in the experimental group price was 2.12 $/kg, respectively. This increase in the price of chicken meat is negligible compared to the much better and healthier product that comes at the end which is intended for human consumption.

Author Full Names: Nuintin, Adriano Antonio; Leal Calegario, Cristina Lelis
Article Title: Analysis of the effect of the use of new technology and the specificities of agribusiness in the cost of labor during the harvest of coffee
Author Keywords: Innovation; Agribusiness; Cost of Labor; Harvest of Coffee
Abstract: The study aims to analyze the effect of the use of new technology and the specifics of the agribusiness in the cost of labor during the harvest of coffee. The study is characterized as an explanatory research with quantitative analysis of the data, performed using data from the phase of the coffee harvest. For data analysis, statistical techniques were used as descriptive statistics, Pearson correlation analysis and multiple linear regression allowing to identify the relationship between the independent and dependent variables. As a result, research has shown that innovation in the production process, as evidenced by the partial substitution of labor by machinery during harvest contributes to reducing labor cost per bag. Showed that the time factor related to the specificity of agribusiness perishability results in the rapid increase in the payment of collectors around the need to harvest the grain in less time not sacrificing quality. Another point concerning the specificity of agribusiness is related to the seasonality of production, in other words, the quantity harvested suffers influences the biennial cycle of production resulting in an increase or decrease in the cost of labor in coffee activity.

Author Full Names: Lopes Santos, David Ferreira; Jurca, Fernanda Lemos
Article Title: Analysis of investment in feedlot cattle in the central-western Brazil: a case study
Author Keywords: Discounted Cash Flow; Real Options Theory; Feedlot Cattle
Abstract: This study analyzed the economic viability of an investment in feedlot cattle on a farm in the midsize state of Goias. The research identified that different thematic studies whose interests have focused mainly on cost analysis and profitability punctual. Differently, this study used the approaches of the Discounted Cash Flow (DCF) and the Real Options Theory (ROT). The first used the projected cash flow for 10 years and a discount rate determined by CAPM at 8% p.a. for containment of heads 400. The second was modeled by the binomial model of Cox, Ross and Rubinstein (1979) incorporating the option of waiting. This methodology has not been employed in Brazilian cattle industry. The search results pointed to the economic viability of the project when considered possible scenarios for the different price ranges of the ox that state bushel. In addition, the TOR proved to be a more robust tool for investment analysis, by incorporating the flexibility of farmers to wait for the right time to make the confinement.

Authors: Wissmann, MA; Hein, AF; Neuls, H
Author Full Names: Wissmann, Martin Airton; Hein, Andre Fernando; Neuls, Helio
Article Title: Waste generation: an analysis of eco-efficiency in production lines in a dairy industry and its influence on environmental costs
Author Keywords: Production; Environmental Costs; Eco-efficiency
Abstract: The awakening of firms to environmental problems generated by industrial processes, took significant proportions in recent decades, when the realization that natural resources are finite, and that the misuse of them tend to accelerate the destruction of the terrestrial biosphere. The financial resources invested in environmental companies, came to be seen by entrepreneurs as a real possibility of obtaining benefits, both in terms of saving resources as well as for the preservation of the environment. This research aimed to identify the relationship between the volumes of waste generated in the production lines in a dairy company, the influence on the environmental costs and eco-efficiency achieved in terms of resources used and produced volumes. The methodology consisted of interviews with the leaders of the environmental and management of the company, were also consulted documents, reports and direct checks along the production sectors. The study was developed through a case study in a quantitative way, with the use of bibliographic data, documentary and research in situ along the production lines. The results showed that the knowledge about the volume and type of waste generated in each production line makes more efficient the actions taken by the company in order to reduce the environmental impacts and costs caused by the industry. The application of simple measurements on the production lines, reflected in significant gains in both environmental aspects as well as the financial aspect of the company, considering the treatment and proper disposal of each type of waste.

Authors: de Araujo, ARM; da Rosa, FS; Pfitscher, ED
Author Full Names: Machado de Araujo, Alessandra Rodrigues; da Rosa, Fabricia Silva; Pfitscher, Elisete Dahmer
Article Title: Classifying the sustainability costs: a classification proposal for an enterprise at farming research area and rural extension
Author Keywords: Environmental Sustainability; Sustainability Costs; Enterprise of Farming Research
Abstract: This study aims to propose parameters of sustainability cost classifications for an enterprise of farming research and rural extension. For this objective to be reached was followed the specific targets: to identify the environmental sustainability level of the enterprise; to propose a short planning of environmental management; to present cost classification for the studied enterprise. The methodology according to the objectives is descriptive and explanatory where it is used a case study to propose sustainability cost classification for an enterprise of farming research. The results showed a Global Sustainability of 16,07% what means that it is in the Deficit level, verifying as opportunities to improve aspect indicators with worker's health; to integrate data about impact with technology; to evaluate the technological contribution for environmental conservation; to disclosure the economic benefits of the region. The costs related with these proposed benefits were classified as: Costs with energy, water and other materials that change themselves in wastes and emissions; Prevention costs and other costs of sustainable management; Costs with emission and waste controls; Costs with research and development and intangible costs.

Authors: Vilela, MC; de Araújo, KD; Machado, LD; Machado, MRR
Author Full Names: Vilela, Maria Celma; de Araujo, Kleber Domingues; Machado, Lucio de Souza; Rodrigues Machado, Michele Rilany
Article Title: Feasibility analysis of financial and economic project in excavated aquaculture tanks
Author Keywords: Economic and financial viability; Pisciculture; Technical/analytical methods
Abstract: This work aimed to study the various techniques / methods of investment analysis, and analyze economic and financial feasibility of investment in fish farming in ponds, with the creation of tambaqui (Colossoma macropomum). The research sought to describe the main stages of evaluation of new investments by addressing the projected cash flow, calculating the cost of capital employed and the application of evaluation techniques and tools to support the process of planning, execution and control activities. For theoretical foundations of the techniques / methods a study was done on the concepts, advantages and disadvantages of each of these, culminating in the selection of some of them to be carried out to analyze the economic feasibility of investment. In the process of examining the feasibility of activity were prepared Balance Sheet and the Statement of Income, the estimated investment cash flow, determining the minimum rate of attractiveness for business analysis of the net present value (NPV), internal rate of return (IRR), profitability index (LI), payback period of investment (discounted payback) and economic value added (EVA). In this way this worked was verified that the production of tambaqui (Colossoma macropomum) in ponds was not feasible because the indicators of economic and financial feasibility proved unfavorable, with profitability likely less than 1 (one), negative NPV, IRR below the minimum rate of attractiveness, time of return over 10 years and EVA negative in all years.

Author Full Names: de Oliveira Neto, Odilon Jose; Garcia, Fabio Gallo
Article Title: Cross hedging the argentinian steers in the futures market of the brazilian live cattle
Author Keywords: Live cattle; Cross hedging; Future markets
Abstract: The present study verifies the effectiveness of cross hedge operations for Argentinians steers by negotiation with futures contracts of the Brazilian live cattle in the Brazilian Securities, Commodities and Futures Exchange (BM&FBOVESPA). The hypothesis tested is that the optimal combination of futures contracts in futures market of the Brazilian live cattle with the spot position in market of the Argentinian steer is efficient in maximizing of expected utility in terms of the mitigating price risk. The growth of the acting of multinationals Brazilian of beef industries sector in Argentina and the ascertainment of what, in Argentina, many negotiation attempts of the future contracts beef cattle were frustrated along years, are elements which justify conducting this study. The effectiveness of the cross hedging was verified by application of strategies of the full and optimal coverage. The minimum variance Ederington (1979) and BEKK Engle and Kroner (1995) and Baba et al. (1990) models were used to estimate the optimal cross hedge ratio. The results show that there is strong evidences of futures market efficiency for Brazilian live cattle in risk management spot prices of Argentinians steers.

Author Full Names: Marques Serrano, Andre Luiz; da Cunha Oliveira Neto, Jose Carneiro
Article Title: Statistical analysis of the economic sector in cotton production in Mato Grosso and Bahia
Author Keywords: Economic statistics; Indicators; Cotton
Abstract: This article shows, in general, the landscape of agribusiness cotton regions of Mato Grosso and Bahia, in the period 1990 to 2007. For this, we used the method of analysis as measures of regional specialization and localization, which allows the knowledge of the patterns of economic growth in the region as a whole. It was considered as variable, cotton production in these states, verifying that the dynamics of growth of these regions is closely linked to the development of new agricultural frontier of the country, thanks to a high degree of specialization. It is concluded on the facts analyzed the period from 1990 to 2002, the segment of the cotton industry had a wider distribution in the territory of the percentage of the amount produced. Already in the following years, from 2003 to 2007, was contacted, based on data analysis, the analyzed regions of the cotton farmer sector expanded, given a large influx of investment, which resulted in a high degree of specialization in the sector and greater dynamic, consolidating the regions studied according to the expectations set, such as regions with highly specialized production.

Article Title: Bovine cattle production costing: review under cost accounting focus
Author Keywords: Cattle cutting; Cost center; Opportunity cost
Abstract: Cost control in livestock is one of the factors that contribute to business success. In the literature, among articles published regarding livestock costs, the authors come primarily in the areas of animal husbandry and veterinary medicine. The contribution of cost accounting is relevant and should be part of the collection of scientific papers on this subject. The aim of this article was to review some existing publications on livestock costs and to compare with the cost accounting literature. It was observed that the approach taken in these articles written so far is different from the theories of costs presented by the authors of cost accounting, especially the concepts of cost, expense and investment. In one of the articles a figure found ignores how indirect costs should be allocated to the product, transforming them into direct costs. Another point of conflict is about the return on capital and land, disregarded in product cost accounting.

Article Title: An analysis of tomato prices at wholesale level in Turkey: an application of SARIMA model.
Author Keywords: Tomato Prices; SARIMA model; Turkey
Abstract: Price forecasting is more acute with vegetable crops particularly tomato due to its highly perishable nature and seasonality. Forecasting tomato prices can provide critical and useful information to tomato growers making production and marketing decisions. The objectives of this paper were to analyse the seasonal price variation of tomato crop and to develop a Seasonal ARIMA (SARIMA) model to forecast the monthly tomato prices at wholesale level in Antalya, a city located in the Mediterranean Region, Turkey, on the basis of reported prices from 2000 to 2010. In addition, some suggestions were made for the existing and potential tomato producers based on the predicted prices of tomato. The highest tomato prices adjusted seasonaly appear on October. SARIMA (1, 0, 0) (1, 1, 1) 12 model was selected as the most suitable model to forecast of tomato prices. It is clear that tomato prices will not considerably flactuate by 2014 on the real base. It is important to produce tomato with GAP techniques against the price risks.

Authors: Markovic, T; Ivanovic, S; Pajic, M
Author Full Names: Markovic, Todor; Ivanovic, Sanjin; Pajic, Milos
Article Title: Costs and profit in chamomile production using weather put option
Author Keywords: Chamomile; Weather put option; Costs
Abstract: Chamomile is very important medicinal and aromatic plant, and is used in many industries. The goal of this paper is to analyze the effect of risk elimination (effect of hedging) in production of chamomile in Serbia using weather put option based on the quantity of precipitation. The analysis is based on calculations of average costs of chamomile production per hectare, costs of agricultural mechanization, and determination of profit in chamomile production. To structure weather put option the key issue is calculation of option payoff and evaluation of risk price (fair premium) a buyer is willing to pay for risk transfer. Fair premium is determined by burn-rate method. Chamomile revenue is calculated with use of the weather derivatives and without them using stochastic simulation method. Calculations are performed by appropriate computer software (@ Risk). Results have shown that use of weather put option is efficient only if production location is in the immediate vicinity of weather station and if the correlation between quantity of precipitation and chamomile yield is high.

Authors: de Souza, MR; de Vargas, FM; de Souza, LCF; Talamini, E; Camilo, FR
Author Full Names: de Souza, Marcio Rodrigues; de Vargas Junior, Fernando Miranda; Ferreira de Souza, Luiz Carlos; Talamini, Edson; Camilo, Fernando Rossi
Article Title: Economic analysis of confinement of lambs fed with in natura or disabled grass hay piata and soybeans
Author Keywords: Costs; Finishing lambs; Economic viability
Abstract: The purpose of this study was to evaluate the profitability and economic viability of the lambs termination in confinement compared four diets with different proportions of grass hay Brachiaria brizantha cv. BRS Piata and fresh disabled soybean. In the survey was used information zootechnical and economic confinement of 20 lambs and, based on this information a simulation was done by designing an enclosure with accommodation for 50 animals per cycle termination. The fixed cost were analyzed, like as the variable, effective operating cost, total operating cost and total cost, its components and their participation in the total cost. In all diets the acquisition cost in finishing lambs had the highest share in total cost, followed by food, labor, taxes and variable rates, and interest on working capital. The finishing period influenced the number of lots and the number of animals terminated during the year and the production of carcass. It was found that the increase in use of soy concentrates and disabled increase production efficiency and improve economic performance in finishing lambs in confinement. However the diets evaluated had negative economic results, therefore, are not economically viable.

Authors: Tessaro, G; da Motta, MEV; Pacheco, MTM; Camargo, ME; Zanandrea, G; Menegotto, MLA
Author Full Names: Tessaro, Graciela; Ventura da Motta, Marta Elisete; Martiningui Pacheco, Maria Teresa; Camargo, Maria Emilia; Zanandrea, Gabriela; Arbugeri Menegotto, Margarete Luisa
Article Title: Funding for absorption of dry table wine Isabel: a case study in cooperative agroindustrial GT
Author Keywords: Costs; Wine; Sales Price
Abstract: This study aimed to describe, conceptualize and analyse the costs directed to the wine sector, as well as taxes, expenses and selling price. Among the product mix of the Agroindustrial Cooperative GT chose to search the table dry red wine and its forms of marketing. Among the costing methods used the absorption costing method for appropriating all manufacturing overheads and this be permitted by fiscal legislation. Identified the determining factors for the formation of the selling price and the result by type of packaging used by the cooperative. The present work is featured as a case study and data surveys were conducted through literature review, interviews and documentary research. After the data was surveys used descriptive analysis where one can assume some results, among them that the packaging is crucial and impacting on the formation of the selling price of dry table red wine Isabel; the contendo750 ml bottle provides greater result on other packages, representing 15.58 on the selling price, and that the packaging with lower return is 2,000 ml providing result of 10.95 on the selling price.

Authors: Costa, CHG; de Castro, LG; Andrade, FT; Calegario, CLL; de Oliveira, DH
Author Full Names: Garcia Costa, Cassio Henrique; de Castro Junior, Luiz Gonzaga; Andrade, Fabricio Teixeira; Leal Calegario, Cristina Lelis; de Oliveira, Diego Humberto
Article Title: Factors affecting cost management of coffee production in southern Minas Gerais
Author Keywords: Determinants; Management costs; Coffee
Abstract: The south of Minas Gerais is the largest coffee producing region of the state and Brazil. One problem of the productive sector of the coffee currently concerns the management of coffee farms, the inability of these management companies. The current economic situation demands paradigm shift agents, able to adapt to the new context, which is more extensive and dynamic. The management costs of production plays an important role in this scenario, because it generates information used as a measure of organizational performance and operational since summarizes the efficiency of the production process in the transformation of resources employed in the business in a common monetary unit. The main objective of this study is to determine which factors affecting the management of production costs of farmers in southern Minas Gerais. The method used in the indication of the factors is based on the estimation of binomial logit model. The main factors affecting the management of production costs of farmers in southern Minas Gerais are schooling, the use of information and the number of employees hired by farmers. The management costs for the farm sector, where the producer has an efficient control of the sector and its cost of production is the area that requires further and use by growers of information technology.

Authors: Felipe, IJDS; Mol, ALR; Almeida, VDE; de Brito, MC
Author Full Names: dos Santos Felipe, Israel Jose; Rezende Mol, Anderson Luiz; de Souza e Almeida, Vinicio; de Brito, Marcio Carvalho
Article Title: Application of ARIMA models in soybean series of prices in the north of Parana
Author Keywords: Time Series; ARIMA Models; soybean prices
Abstract: This study aims to analyze the series of daily prices of soybeans in the North of Parana, which includes the timeline of the years 2000 (from January) to 2011 (until October) and describe their behavior with short-term forecasts. That is, verify if the temporal dynamics of the variable is better explained by a process: Auto-regressive of order p, moving Average of order q, Auto-regressive and moving Average of order p, q; Auto-regressive, Integrated and moving Average and of order p, d, q; or seasonal ARIMA of order (p, d, q), (P, D, Q). The Box and Jenkins methodology (1976) was used to answer this question. The manipulation of data was based on graphical analysis and statistical tests of the methodology itself, through which, it was observed that the ARIMA (5,0,0) or simply AR (5), responded as the best model among the set of models tested to predict the prices of soybeans.

Authors: Morozini, JF; Martin, DML; Cardoso, CE
Author Full Names: Morozini, Joao Francisco; Leiva Martin, Diogenes Manoel; Cardoso, Carlos Eduardo
Article Title: Real options theory for risk analysis and pricing of input and output on a coffee plantation in Brazil
Author Keywords: Real options; Investment analysis; Coffee plantation; Mean reversion
Abstract: Agricultural production be it of any nature is essentially production under conditions of risk. Soon necessarily by information asymmetry and cognitive bias is common practice to strategic errors, ie, errors that involve destruction of economic value of farming throughout his life, compromising continuity. The aim of this paper is the application of Real Options Theory, according to the model suggested by Dixit and Pindyck (1994) in the version of Luong and Tauer (2004) for determining the entry price and exit an investment project in a coffee plantation depending on market behavior. This model is underpinned by the Theory of Real Options analysis for decision making under risk. The model seeks to determine prices trigger to invest and abandon the crop due to the behavior of prices and costs of starting production, maintenance and abandonment of farming the crop. The methodology used is quantitative, seeking to show how the input and output prices are affected by the behavior of market prices over time, fixed costs, variable and time the crop establishment. Since the goal of the work involves the use of time series, it is convenient that we can use the series to present the largest number of observations. The series with the largest number of observations is published by the International Coffee Organization, denominated in cents per pound. This research showed the superiority of the real options model in contrast to empirical models of decision making by farmers and the model offered by conventional neoclassical theory regarding the determination of the points of entry and exit of the crop.

Article Title: Analysis of production costs, productivity and profitability on three technologies of cultivation of irrigated rice on the farm Sao Sebastiao, Querencia do Norte, PR
Author Keywords: Pre-germinated Rice; Crop Technology; Production Costs
Abstract: This study aims to verify and analyze the technical and economic viability of irrigated rice in face of three technology models of cultivation: a) first planting, b) second planting c) ratoon, describing and distinguishing the technology models and analyzing and comparing production costs. The study was conduct in the farm Sao Sebastiao, municipality of Querencia do Norte. First, were described the technologies and later the production costs per hectare (ha) for each technology adopted. Among the three technological models, which the highest cost of production is the first planting, along with the most revenue. But as the study seeks to determine which of the two other technologies (second planting and ratoon) is the more viable, it's observed that the ratoon technology has the lowest cost of production and most profitability, moreover, is the ratoon cultivation there is lower wear and tear of machinery and equipment. So, conclude that the more viable technology both in production conditions, financial and procedural, is the ratoon technology. In the conditions presented this technology is the most appropriate and profitable to be adopted after the crop of the first planting technology.

Authors: Stankovic, S; Arsic, N; Rakic, M
Author Full Names: Stankovic, Sanja; Arsic, Nina; Rakic, Marko
Article Title: The research on the presence of health claims on the domestic food market as an indicator of consumer rights manipulation
Author Keywords: Risk; Consumer rights; Health claims
Abstract: Modern society is increasingly more defined by the relationship between the production and consumption risks - environmental, health, economic and many others. The risks affect the development of civilization, they find their way into our everyday lives and influence the decisions we make. Circulation and the risk increase determine our decisions in a variety of choices we face on a daily basis. The Republic of Serbia still remains a fertile ground for numerous manipulations regarding consumer rights, particularly in terms of health claims for food products, which tend to minimize the risks of non-organic or inadequate nutrition. This manipulative minimization of risk is reflected through the presence of food products with such visual identity that could affect the consumer's choice of purchase, believing that they made a healthy choice for themselves and their environment. This paper presents the results of an empirical research of the presence of health claims on food products available on the market of the Republic of Serbia. The survey was conducted on a sample of four supermarkets in Novi Sad, according to those groups of food products that belong among common foods in the daily diet of the people in Serbia.

Authors: Vasconcelos, YL; Yoshitake, M; de França, SM; da Silva, GF
Author Full Names: Vasconcelos, Yumara Lucia; Yoshitake, Mariano; de Franca, Suely Morais; da Silva, Georgia Fabiana
Article Title: Methods of costing applicable to nurseries
Author Keywords: Nursery; Absorption cost; Variable cost
Abstract: The nurseries are designed to produce seedlings for a long period (continued use). This type of business demands higher level of sophistication and cost control, requiring more accurate planning. This article aims to analyze the adherence to the methods of absorption cost and variable to the dynamics of these projects, considering the operational aspects involved. The proposed study is justified by the role of nurseries in the Brazilian economy. The scarcity of seedlings with the required technical quality, may be an obstacle to the development of rural activities in various sub-areas. A qualitative research, bibliographic in nature, has been used and about the objectives, presents mixed descriptive and exploratory approach, since, besides analyzing the infrastructure of four (4) forest nurseries, characterizing the market in question, the vision of organizational developments as improved, under the focus of cost management. Results show that the four nurseries researched, three of them have no type of control costs. Prices are set imprecisely, by applying a percentage to the estimated costs. In these projects, operational management is alien to accounting and financial management. The absorption costing method appears to be more suitable to the reality of nurseries, since the distortions caused by the cost sharing do not drastically impact the final result.

Authors: de Oliveira, JR; Rech, IJ; Carneiro, JBA; Niveiros, SI
Author Full Names: de Oliveira, Josemar Ribeiro; Rech, Ilirio Jose; Arbues Carneiro Junior, Joao Bosco; Niveiros, Sofia Ines
Article Title: Environmental cost on cotton: a case study in the southern region of Mato Grosso
Author Keywords: Cotton; Environmental Cost; Management
Abstract: One of the main difficulties encountered by the rural sector is the allocation of environmental costs incurred during the production process. In the case of a continuous production process further doubts arise about what the appropriate treatment and the effects on economic performance of the costs incurred by a company producer of cotton in protecting and preserving the environment. In this sense this article aims to examine the effect of environmental costs in the economic performance of a company producing cotton. To achieve the proposed objective method was used as a case study in a company located in southern Mato Grosso. Have been calculated the costs of production of cotton per hectare without considering the environmental costs were identified and then spending on environmental protection and preservation and transferred to the cost of production. Was verified that the environmental costs when allocated to the products in the proper ratio increases the production costs of 3.3%. However, the effect on income was more than 27% in the period. In the case of economic performance environmental costs had impact of more than 29% return on investment influencing the profitability of the company. The reflections contained in this article demonstrate the need to identify the environmental costs and their impact on production costs of cotton, serving as relevant data in making decisions.

Authors: Magalhaes, KB; Rodrigues, W; da Silveira, MA
Author Full Names: Magalhaes, Keile Beraldo; Rodrigues, Waldecy; da Silveira, Marcio Antonio
Article Title: Social cost-benefit analysis chain production of ethanol of sweet potato in Tocantins State
Author Keywords: Replacement cost method; Environmental costs; Commodities and environment
Abstract: Since the decade of 90 with the increase of the soy price in the international market other areas from Brazilian savannah had been incorporated to the soy production. Three cities can be detached in the process: Luis Eduardo Magalhaes - BA, Balsas - MA and Pedro Afonso TO. This expansion can mean the magnifying of ambient impacts in ground in the water resources, the biodiversity and the conditions of ecological balance of the Brazilian savannah. The study measures monetarily, through Replacement Cost Method, the ambient impacts of soy plantation technologies in the region of recent expansion in the Brazilian savannah, having as case study the city of Pedro Afonso - TO. In the specific region of the study the annual ambient costs of the soy production had been esteem in R$ 2,24 /ha. However, the progressive adoption of more producing for no tillage can reduce this value for R$ 0,61/ha.

Authors: de Souza, RA; Padua, DMC; Oliveira, RPD; Maia, TCB
Author Full Names: de Souza, Rui Alves; Cantisani Padua, Delma Machado; de Castro Oliveira, Raquel Priscila; Barcelos Maia, Tule Cesar
Article Title: Economic analysis of tambaqui creation in net tanks: a case study in settlement of land reform
Author Keywords: Pisciculture; Production costs; Profitability indicators
Abstract: Aquaculture is a crucial source of income and livelihood for millions of people around the world. Most fish farms require technical knowledge expertise and qualified staff. This research was developed in Santa Felicidade Settlement Project Cocalzinho de Goias city - GO, where a substantial part of the settlers by INCRA are exploring subsistence farming activities. After meeting open to the 76 settler's families, those who joined the project received courses on intensive farming of tambaqui (Colossoma macropomum) in net cages. The production was an innovative technique, fully realized with the participatory labor of family members, without prejudice of the main activities. The economic analysis showed the return on invested capital in 7.5 years within the financial activity with 7.1% Internal Return Rate higher than the average interest rate market. The Net Cash Flow showed ability to fulfill financial obligations from the second year. The implementation of more productive cycles optimizes the workforce with increased operational efficiency. Diet alternatively produced with local ingredients can minimize the effects of critical variables of the project, since it does not affect productivity.

Author Full Names: Ricardo, Tiago Ribeiro; Wander, Alcido Elenor
Article Title: Profitability and risk of annual crops in Rio Verde/GO
Author Keywords: Cost; Risk; Management
Abstract: To evaluate the economic viability and the possibility of reducing the risk of some crops competing for land use in Rio Verde GO was necessary to review the cost methods used in rural areas and other of knowledge and shaping a methodology that suits the management portfolio. Therefore, this article brings not only a revisit to methodologies of costs calculation for rural activities and suggests its use in portfolio theory to support rural management. One result of this study is that it is possible to reduce the risk of rural activities through cultivating different crops during the same season.

Authors: Fiorentin, FR; Oliveira, DD; de Souza, JA; Custódio, EMO
Author Full Names: Fiorentin, Fernando Rodrigo; Oliveira, Deyvison de Lima; de Souza, Jose Arilson; Oliveira Custodio, Elizangela Maria
Article Title: Fair value and cost in the production of flowers: an approach to the net cash flow
Author Keywords: CPC 29; Fair Value; Biological Asset
Abstract: Given the recent adoption of fair value for the measurement of biological assets in the Brazilian context, this paper makes a proposal for measurement of assets in the production of roses in accordance with item 20 of CPC 29, which prescribes the present value of cash flow expected as an alternative definition of fair value, given the current discount rate of the market. After knowing the management of two local producers, by the approach of case studies, we used the data provided to formulate a proposal of financial flows with a view to measuring the fix asset (rosebush) at fair value, in accordance with the recommendations of item 20 of CPC 29. Through the proposed method was possible to bring at present value the total 100 square meters of rosebushes in production, using a discount rate that best reflects the productive reality in the Amazonia's zone. The proposal can be applied to measure the fair value of biological assets similar. Limitations and research opportunities are presented in the conclusions.

Author Full Names: Rezende Mol, Anderson Luiz; Aldatz, Ramiro Jorge
Article Title: Territorial integration in the shrimp market
Author Keywords: cointegration; Law of One Price; Granger Causality
Keywords Plus: ONE PRICE; TIME-SERIES; UNIT-ROOT; COINTEGRATION; LAW; ARBITRAGE
Abstract: The goal of this study is to investigate the long term relations of the shrimp price paid to the producer in 4 regions of the state of Rio Grande do Norte. The historical series represent the average prices (jan/2008 to dec/2011) paid per shrimp of 12 to 15 grams, in natura, deflated by the Producer Price Index, obtained among producers of 4 different regions of RN. To determine the integration relation of the variables, it were applied tests of unit root of Dickey and Fuller, cointegration of Johansen, causality of Granger and tests of the parameters beta and alpha of the cointegration vectors. Once evaluated the relevance of each region in the cointegration vector by the hypotheses beta(i) = 0, it was tested the perfect integration hypotheses (beta(i) = -beta(j)). After the analysis it was able to see that the 4 regions are equilibrated under the Law of One Price and causality tests contrast the analysis pointing to bicausality, in Granger's sense, between the regions of Vale do Acu and Natal-Macaiba; Natal-Macaiba and Litoral Sul, aside from the unicausal relation of the microrregion Litoral Nordeste toward the region Vale do Acu.

Authors: Silveira, LG; Soares, MA; da Silva, MA
Author Full Names: Silveira, Leonardo Gervasio; Soares, Mara Alves; da Silva, Marli Auxiliadora
Article Title: Profitability of beef cattle in the growing phase: use of Monte Carlo simulation for planning and controlling business
Author Keywords: Cattle cutting; Profitability; Monte Carlo Simulation
Abstract: Ranchers often make decisions based on feeling, which can reduce profits. Thus, the use of control techniques and tools specific cost projection allows to avaluate the performance and make investments that generate higher returns. Thus, to evaluate the profitability of farming beef cattle in the rearing in extensive pastures and paddocks rotated in developed this case study on a rural property in Pontal Tri ngulo Mineiro using the technique of Monte Carlo simulation modeling proposed by Mendes, Zocolotto and Nossa (2009). Entered in the simulation data up to four input derised situations based on minimum and maximum values considered by the farmer by generating 500 different posssible combinations for each variable reported, and an expected return on investiment in animals at least 30%. The results show that in all situations proposals, the average return is higher than expected and the risk of injury is zero, concluding, based on simulation results and according to the variables related to the process of livestock production that the activity of beef cattle in the growing phase is safe and profitable.

Authors: Nuintin, AA; Curi, MA; dos Santos, AC
Author Full Names: Nuintin, Adriano Antonio; Curi, Maria Aparecida; dos Santos, Antonio Carlos
Article Title: Characterization and analysis of transactions resulting from the employment of labor in the coffee activity from the optical in the of Transaction Cost Economy
Author Keywords: Transaction Cost Economics; Agribusiness; Employment of Labor
Abstract: This work aims to characterize and analyze the contracts and forms of governance relating to transactions on the recruitment of labor in agribusiness from the perspective of transaction cost economics. The transaction cost economics studies the transaction costs as an inducer of the alternative modes of production organization - governance. Governance structures can occur through the market, via hierarchy and mixed. Depending on the characteristics of transactions and institutional environment, contracts are classified as classical, neoclassical and relational. An important economic sector is agribusiness, which has some peculiarities such as seasonality of production, hiring of temporary labor. The study is characterized as an exploratory, qualitative approach to data held by a case study in an organization that operates the coffee activity in the South of Minas Gerais. The survey instrument used for data collection was a questionnaire with open and closed questions. The work showed that the recruitment of labor for carrying out the activity of the coffee harvest generates legal obligations and requirements of transactions with the market to achieve the operational and economic performance expected. According to the theory and the information collected in the case study, it was possible to characterize and analyze transactions and depending on the specificity and frequency, to identify the forms of governance and types of contracts between employers and employees in rural areas.
